author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> > <nicoserranop>  The current auth workflow is:

1. Get the url for the external OIDC using `/auth/request_link`. You can specify a redirect URL of your implementation using `/auth/request_link?redirect_to=REDIRECT_URL`

2. Signing with the external OIDC. After a successful login it should redirect back to the sequencer.

3. The sequencer would take the external OIDC data and generate a sessionId. If a redirect URL was provided in step 1, it would redirect there. Remember that the sessionId should go in a Authorization Header: Bearer SESSION_ID


You may be using the data from step 2 and not the one from step 3 üòä (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <MariusVanDerWijden> I always get `unknown session id` when trying with my own implementation. I use the sessionid returned by the siwe server
Any ideas on how to debug this would be great, I'm kinda at my wits end)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
No I'm using the `session_id`field that is set in the query to the redirect url (afaict)
This one: `http://127.0.0.1:3000/auth/callback/eth?session_id=147312e0-a03e-4469-9ce5-fc0b56bf1f81&sub=eth%7C0xb02a2eda1b317fbd16760128836b0ac59b560e9d&nickname=0xb02a2eda1b317fbd16760128836b0ac59b560e9d&provider=Ethereum&exp=18446744073709551615`
